resources.string: Adhell is not yet supported on your device.
To enable Adhell, you must activate Admin mode for this app. \nAdhell uses Samsung APIs which require the Device Administrator permission.
Adhell utilizes Samsung\'s Knox Firewall, which requires a free developer license key.
Your device is not connected to the Internet.
Whitelist domains \nTurn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.
Do you really want to uninstall Adhell? This will also enable all disabled apps!
Change these only if you know what DNS is for and what benefits or problems editing could cause. Note that Adhell must be enabled.
Blacklist domains or define deny firewall rules \nTurn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.

Firewall rule format: 
packageName|ipAddress|port 
E.g. block port 53 for all IP addresses in Chrome: 
com.android.chrome|*|53
Domains support wildcards, e.g. *facebook.com \nRule format to allow a domain in a specific app: \npackageName|domain
Do you really want to enable all app\'s permissions?
Do you want to add the selected domain to whitelist?
DNS addresses have been set. Turn Adhell off and on to take effect.
DNS has been restored to defaults. Turn Adhell off and on to take effect.
In addition to Adhell\'s standard package, you can add links to remote and local hosts lists. \nAdhell can block up to %1$d unique domains.
Your device is running an old version of Knox, so this function may be unstable.
Manage which apps should be disabled from system entirely. \nThe app is disabled immediately and it won\'t show up on app drawer.
Manage which apps are allowed to use mobile data. \nTurn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.
Manage which apps are allowed to use Wi-Fi data. \nTurn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.
Manage which apps should be whitelisted from ads blocker. \nTurn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.
Applications generally do not handle any missing permissions. \nA removed permission may lead an application to crash. \nChanges on app permissions are applied immediately.
Do you really want to enable all apps?
Do you really want to backup the database and replace any existing backup?
Do you really want to restore the database and replace your entire setup?
